Enjoy your alternate history movie exploration!

This film is a captivating true story set during the Great Depression about an undersized racehorse that went on to become a national symbol of hope. The star-studded cast including Jeff Bridges and Tobey Maguire adds to its charm.

Another film that might pique your interest is "The Trouble with Harry". This quirky comedy-drama from the 1950s revolves around the mysterious death of a man named Harry, and the townsfolk's comical attempts to dispose of his body. It features appearances by Alfred Hitchcock himself!

Based on your interest in war-themed films with a mix of excitement and warmth, I would highly recommend "Three Kings". This film follows a group of soldiers on a mission during the Gulf War, and it's filled with action, camaraderie, and a touch of humor, thanks to an all-star cast including George Clooney and Mark Wahlberg.

If you're open to venturing into a more fantastical war setting, "Princess Mononoke" is another great choice. This animated masterpiece from Studio Ghibli tells the story of a warrior princess in feudal Japan who battles against a mining colony that threatens the forest spirits she protects. Starring voices like Claire Danes and Billy Bob Thornton, it's a unique blend of adventure, mythology, and environmental themes. Enjoy!

I would highly recommend giving either of these films a watch if you're interested in exploring the complexities of war through compelling storytelling.

If you're interested in exploring more historical dramas, "The Patriot" is another great option. Mel Gibson stars as a peaceful farmer who is forced to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a British officer murders his son. Enjoy!

Given your interest in war films, I'd like to recommend two movies from the list you provided that may appeal to you.

Firstly, "The Pianist" is a moving drama about a Polish musician who struggles during World War II. It stars Frank Finlay, Emilia Fox, and Ed Stoppard.
